chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon John Phipps

records.addlTxt: State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
11:14 AM Defendant Devon John Phipps in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Devon John Phipps.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions. 
Defendant pleads not guilty to traffic ticket and request it trail.  Court accepts plea; citation to trail.
Arraignment scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.

1:55 PM Defendant Devon John Phipps appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Devon John Phipps.  Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $250 cash. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. State did not find local record (WI and MN). Defendant does have MN address. Attorney Hoffman notes that there is no record of FTAs. Lifelong resident of St. Louis County with family in the area. Has no employment and cannot post much money. Attorney Hoffman asks for high dollar signature bond. 
Court orders $2000 signature bond. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 11:15 am.
